name: Hyatt at The Bellevue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone who works there is polite and helpful. The room I stayed in was old, but beautiful, nicely maintained and well-furnished. The bathroom was modern and luxurious. I agree with other reviewers that the facility is a bit odd, with the check-in desk on the 19th floor, but so what. There really isn't a traditional hotel lobby here, but the doormen and concierge (in the lobby) were very friendly, kind and helpful. The restaurant, bar and breakfast areas on the 19th floor were superb. I cannot understand the complaints of another reviewer about the seating at the breakfast/lunch area; I thought it was one of the best such areas of the many hotels at which I've stayed. The staff there all served me promptly and politely. The decor in the hallways is a bit overdone, but at least it's not the cookie-cutter industrial look of so many Marriotts, Hyatts, and Hiltons. There are plenty of good hotels within easy walking distance of each other in the heart of Philadelphia. Check prices and book accordingly. All these big hotels in the heart of Philly aren't really all that different. I got a great deal there thanks to AmEx Platinum.
reviews.title: I liked it

likes.liked: — The breakfast/lunch area on the 19th floor.
likes.disliked: — Hallway decorations are overdone; takes away from the elegance of the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the Park Hyatt on Saturday for a quick one nigh stay. First off the Park Hyatt has a great location at the corner of Broad and Walnut Street. The hotel is easy to find but the entrance is located on a side street/alley and not on either Broad or Walnut. You walk into a lower lobby but need to take the elevator up to the 19th floor to the reception area.
reviews.title: A bad hodgepodge of design and fire alarm issues

likes.disliked: — Outdated decor in hallways and rooms

reviews.text: The reception/lobby/restaurant area you enter when exiting the elevator is beautiful. The overall decor is very modern but tastefully done like most Park Hyatts. We checked-in without any problems and were upgraded to a Park Deluxe (I am a Hyatt Diamond member) for our one night stay. The room was located on the 14th floor so you have to take an elevator down to the rooms. When the elevator door opened on the 14th floor I thought we had landed in a different world. The decor of the hallways was awful! Think grandma's retirement community!! The wallpaper was teal with gold accents and the carpeting was a horrible blue pattern. The room itself was also very "old world" and not modern at all. I wasn't expecting a new modern Park Hyatt room but the room we had was not even close to the pictures shown on the Hyatt website. The wallpaper was white with green, blue, gold and brown patterns. The room was very large so we didn't get too bothered by the decor since we were only there for one night. I just can't understand that the rooms have not been updated to match the decor of the lobby area. What a hodgepodge of colors and designs!
reviews.title: They Don't Build Them Like This Anymore (thank goodness!)

reviews.text: Didn't get a very good nights sleep due to noise in the hallway and a fire alarm at 4:30am. The fire alarm announcement continued for over 30 minutes before they finally announced that it was a false alarm. I stay at a lot of hotels and a fire alarm seems to be fairly common today but it really shouldn't take over 30 minutes to deactivate the alarm!!
reviews.title: Grand Dame of broad Street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To summarize...hotel rooms need to be updated to fit in with the lobby area and the Park Hyatt vibe. The location however can't be beat! We did not have any issues with the service provided by the staff as others had mentioned. We actually thought the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome.
reviews.title: Last minute stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best thing about the Park Hyatt is its staff and XIX Nineteen Cafe. Everyone was friendly and very accommodating. Get this, they even come by and ask you if you want more bottle water.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you stay at the Hyatt or even if you don’t stay at Hyatt you must eat at XIX Nineteen. Food is delicious and once again the service is excellent.
reviews.title: Great location for Center City

reviews.text: The hotel is gorgeous. The rooms are spacious and elegant with a beautiful view of the city. All the bathroom amenities you can dream of. Decorated in more traditional look, then contemporary, but nonetheless I still liked it. The locations is excellent, right in the middle of Board Street, down the street from the Kimmel Center, Merriam theater, Academy of Music , restaurants and shops on Walnut Street. Speaking shops the hotel is in the historic Bellevue building which means the Shops of the Bellevue is right under the hotel. How cool is that.
reviews.title: Grand old hotel

reviews.text: Nice place. Booked it sight unseen and thought it to be a bit pricey. We had coupons for the second part of our stay, so we weren't too concerned, but a King Suite runs around $325 a night. We stayed on the 14th floor in an inside room (no view). The room didn't have a coffee maker or fridge (other than the over-priced mini bar) and my wife complained about the length of the cord on the hair dryer (but she had fortunately brought her own in anticipation). Room had an iron, 3 phones, and a bidet. The hotel's best feature seems to be its location, walking distance to most of the center city. Plenty of great restaurants and nightclubs in the area, walking distance even in December cold. The hotel itself was very spacious, check in on the 19th floor was a little weird, valet parking was pricey $30.00/day +tip). We didn't eat at their restaurant but the menus were very expensive ($12.00 for muffins and coffee). Not crowded, saw few guests, staff very helpful, even over the phone. Great exercise facility (5 floors with indoor running track) and Starbucks on the first floor (along with several other stores). Any other questions, we'll be happy to e-mail!
reviews.title: Better Than I Expected

reviews.text: Staying at the Park Hyatt made me feel like I had taken a step back in time. It is a grand hotel, with very interesting architectural features, conveniently located in Philadelphia's theater district. The room that I stayed in was very nicely decorated and comfortable. I would stay here again in a heartbeat if my travels take me back to Philadelphia!
reviews.title: Impressive older hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Bellevue for the weekend. The hotel is in a great location and within walking distance of many historical landmarks. The staff is friendly and the rooms are clean and spacious. The hotel is large but maintains an old world charm. There are shops within the hotel just in case you need to do some last minute shopping.
reviews.title: Charming and great location

reviews.text: I reviewed this hotel a year ago, but had to come back again to say how much we enjoyed staying here again. The staff actually accommodated our request to have the same lovely, quiet corner room! We were disappointed that when we had to return to Philly at the end of Sept., we couldn't get a hotel room here (we stayed at the Res Inn instead - no comparison!). We had a quiet room, commmmmfffffyy beds!! The hotel is central to most everything, including a Williams Sonoma store, restaurants, pub etc. etc. It's a bit of a walk to the closest train station, but the city metro and buses are right there. Staff is sweet - my favorite place to stay in Philly, by far.
reviews.title: Love this elegant hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the best hotel we were in during our 9 days trip to the USA (NYC, Philly and Washington DC).
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is an old and very beautiful architectural building, which will enchant you. Magnificent lacy vaults and marble stairways. A beautiful, lovely and glamorous ballroom.
reviews.title: Good hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: Two big, old and much pleasant rooms in the top level, where you can have breakfast, meals or just a drink in the bar or in the verandas, while you appreciate the Philadelphia Bellevue.
reviews.title: Best gym in philadelphia, older building fine by me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the lobby is nice and the service is wonderful, however, once you take the elevator up to your room you see how outdated this hotel is. I like trendy, modern, and updated. The rooms and hotel floors are old as dirt and hot as hell in the middle of summer. I would never stay here again. The location is good, but there are several other hotels in this area to stay at, like the palomar and the sofitel at the same price.
reviews.title: outdated and old as dirt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was nice, old fashioned, and elegant. My card was charged for the full night amount plus a hold for incidentals, and the front desk agent went out of his way to call my bank and have the charges removed.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: The service was above and beyond!
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a hidden gem in Philly. It is NOT a 5-star hotel, but it is a 5-star value! Exceptional service & friendliness. Was upgraded to a suite since one was available (always a plus in the experience, since not all hotels are "generous"). Great location, definitely worth the stay.
reviews.title: Better then the last time.

reviews.text: great front desk service. Erica was very helpful. You need to be careful what room you get some of the rooms just look right onto the patio of another room which is kind of creepy when you can look out your window and see some one sitting in a chair. We ask for a different room no problem. We also asked for extra billows and they were waiting for us when we got there. The gym is huge and Free the health spa is also free along with the pool. They are all nice, There is a food court in the basement and a few shop and a Starbucks. Room was kept clean. Refrigerator flat screen tv and big walk in closet,
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, but our room was noisy and hot

reviews.text: I love this hotel. The location is perfect, staff is friendly, renovated rooms are modern and practical. Most importantly (for me) - you have direct access to the Bellevue Sporting Club, a phenomenal athletic facility. This alone makes it worthwhile.
reviews.title: Great hotel in fantastic location with amazing gym

reviews.text: There are plenty of power outlets, Internet speeds were fairly decent and bathrooms large.
reviews.title: Great hotel in good area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Make sure you request a renovated room, however. The non-renovated ones are still a little frilly/old.
reviews.title: Very cozy, upscale hotel

reviews.text: Probably the best value in Philly.
reviews.title: Customer service at its best

reviews.text: I stayed at the Bellevue 2 nights in Nov. 2012. It's on Broad, not far from South St. South has lots of fun shops and good restaurants. It's nice to walk in the area.
reviews.title: If you need to travel for work and land in Philly, let it be the Bellevue

reviews.text: We recently stayed here for a conference my husband was attending and to see our daughter who goes to college nearby. After reading the reviews we were hesitant staying here but we found it to be a lovely property and will definitely return. It is old style but is very, very clean, no odors in hallway etc. I had requested a room away from a service elevator so never was disturbed by noise. We did hear noise from outdoors, sirens but brought a small sound machine which masked it. The beds were extremely comfortable, the bedding very nice. I had room service 2 days and it was delivered w/in 15 mins both days and very nice. We also had dinner in the restaurant on the top level - we were able to sit outside. We enjoyed our dinner and would definitely return to the restuarant as well. I have nothing negative to say about our stay or the hotel. There are shops and a Starbucks on the lobby level which is nice to walk around and grab a coffee. Its in a very convenient location as well. We recommend.
reviews.title: Nice Stay at the Bellevue

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt on Friday, 9/21and while I agree with some of the reviewers that said it is "old", I have to say that they have done a lovely job with this very old and historic building. I am from NYC and am used to older buildings. It is beautiful structure and the decor is elegant. The room was clean with a modern flat screen TV. I had the chance to order room service and it was prompt and my simple salad was delicious. The front desk staff was great. I was really tired and checked in late - they were friendly, fast, professional and made me feel welcome. I would definitely stay there again. I had a very positive experience.
reviews.title: Old World Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very well located on Broad Street and near Market Street and City Hall. There are lots of good and variable priced restaurants nearby walking either east or west.
reviews.title: OK for its purpose overnight, but disappointing for a Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the decor of the place is truly awful. Green floral wallpaper and even more green patterned carpet. The room was large, but had no external window, and the bathroom facilities were good but that's it. It is an historical building in dire need of a decent injection of $ to bring it up to a standard where it could be.
reviews.title: excellent location, slightly stuffy

reviews.text: Staff were very variable. Roberta on Reception was very friendly and helpful. Others less so; and the staff in the cafe for breakfast made you feel as if it was an Imposition for you to come in and eat there. The breakfast itself was fine.
reviews.title: Awesome building and staff, room just ok compared to other Hyatts

reviews.text: This hote is a fine propery with good customer service - a great gym - but a hige price tag.
reviews.title: Huge rooms and huge price to go with it

likes.liked: — Incredible gym - free access with the room

reviews.text: The location is great - right in the middle of the downtown with lots of shops, dining and historical attractions within walking distance (and a Starbucks in the lobby of the shopping mall where the hotel is located).
reviews.title: I wanted to stay longer

reviews.text: The lobby is a bit odd - you go into the entrance and then have to go up to the top floor to check in. I found the whole lobby at the top of the building and then having to weave through diners in the lobby/eating area annoying and somehow pretentious - but other than that and the high, high price (possibly par for the course for the location and the fact that it's a full service hotel) I was very satisfied.
reviews.title: Loved the Park Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was huge. Huge. I can't convey it's hugeness. One other problem actually - the huge room I had overlooked a central interior courtyard in which a restaurant is located - this set-up acted like an amplifier so rather late into the night the noise was a problem - a staff member dropping a metal tray sounded like a gong beside my head.
reviews.title: excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym connected to the hotel was incredible - it was a full-service gym with classes and all of the equipment (on multiple levels) you could ever want. You get a day pass from the hotel for free. I have to tell you - even the "gym yoga" class I had was OK ( as gym yoga goes).
reviews.title: There are better choices in Philadelphia

reviews.text: In short, this is a decent hotel, but I wouldn't recommend it to most people.
reviews.title: Decent hotel with glitches; business service problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel reception is located on the 19th floor - a bell desk downstairs directed me up to 19, took my bag, and brought it to the room within 30 seconds of my arrival in the room. Check-in was fast and easy for me, although the person to my left seemed to be having problems. Hotel staff were generally friendly.
reviews.title: An Excellent Hotel

likes.liked: — The facility was very well maintained.

reviews.text: The room was small to medium-sized, very high-ceilinged, decorated with an abundance of pale yellow and green busily patterned wallpapers - the furniture was old-fashioned, but not too tired out, and the room had a few nice don't-see-those-often-anymore amenities (i.e., a valet stand and lit makeup mirror). The room had a cloying sweet scent (chemical-ish, probably related to the heating), but it wasn't noticable after a few minutes. The linens were nice quality, but the upper was only a duvet - not warm enough, and I needed to use the blanket already in the closet - and the bottom was a slightly too small flat sheet, so it and the matress pad slid around and bunched up annoyingly. The shower was fine on the first morning, but not quite warm enough (even when turned up all the way) the second morning.
reviews.title: Loved it

likes.disliked: — hard to find, a few hiccups at check-in but nothing major.

reviews.text: The room service arrived quickly but was not tasty, and was a bit overpriced, even by good-hotel standards. The second night, I took advantage of the (not affiliated to the hotel) Palm steakhouse, located downstairs in the strange little shopping arcade on the first floor of the building, and got a very good filet mignon and creamed spinach to go for a bit less money. The fitness center is actually a full gym located in the same building and is spectacular - the only people I would recommend this hotel to are people for whom a good hotel gym is a key factor.
reviews.title: Disappointed at the Park Hyatt

reviews.text: The biggest problem I had was with business services. The wireless internet ($10/day) was done through t-mobile - the signal was good quality, but the link to bill the service to my room wouldn't work, and the hotel desk was unable to resolve the problem, so I had to bill it direct instead. Much more importantly, I had to send out an important fax one night. Although I emphasized the importance of directing it to one person within my office, it was sent out without even a cover sheet or any fax header identifying the sender, and was therefore bounced around the office throughout the next day, causing great aggravation. More importantly, the documents themselves (my only copies) were not returned to me that evening, and the morning desk staff had to search fairly extensively to locate them.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel!

aka: Hyatt At The Bellevue Hotel Philadelphia
description: A magnificently restored historic National Landmark, the hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Philadelphia's business, restaurant, shopping and theatre districts. Featuring 172 spacious guest rooms, this historic luxury property appeal to all.
